an3.76:4.1: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
an3.76:4.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
an3.76:4.4: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘future existence’.
an3.76:5.1: “If, Ānanda, there were no deeds to result in the sensual realm, would future existence in the sensual realm still come about?”
an3.76:5.3: “So, Ānanda, deeds are the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.
an3.76:5.4: The consciousness of sentient beings—hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving—is established in a lower realm. That’s how there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
an3.76:6.1: If there were no deeds to result in the realm of luminous form, would future existence in the realm of luminous form still come about?”
an3.76:6.3: “So, Ānanda, deeds are the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.
an3.76:6.4: The consciousness of sentient beings—hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving—is established in a middle realm. That’s how there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
an3.76:7.1: If there were no deeds to result in the formless realm, would future existence in the formless realm still come about?”
an3.76:7.3: “So, Ānanda, deeds are the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.
an3.76:7.4: The consciousness of sentient beings—hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving—is established in a higher realm. That’s how there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
an3.76:7.5: That’s how future existence is defined.”
